lead_paragraph: Cuba does not allow people born on the island to travel there by ship. Some Americans who were born there say that the law discriminates against them.

headline.print_headline: Planned Voyage to Cuba Irks Cuban-Born Americans Who Are Not Allowed to Go
headline.main: Carnival’s Maiden Voyage to Cuba Draws Ire and Bias Charges

snippet: Cuba does not allow people born on the island to travel there by ship. Some Americans who were born there say that the law discriminates against them.
abstract: Two Cuban-born American citizens file civil rights suit against Carnival Cruise Line for declining their reservations for upcoming Cuba-bound voyage; Carnival responds to suit by agreeing to take Cuban-born travelers, contingent on Cuban government lifting Cold War-era prohibition on Cubans traveling to and from island by sea; if government refuses to end directive, May 1 voyage will be postponed.
